page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY OF HORNDEAN
page.content: {Gales Brewery}started about 250 years ago. It was sold to a pub next door called the Ship and Bell. It was an old wooden building and was burnt to the ground. It was rebuilt in 1869 in its present Victorian style. Before the {A3(M) motorway} was built there were fields and a forest. Twice a year there was a fair. When the motorway was built lots of wild life disappeared. {Horse Racing}is an ancient sport and originated in Hampshire. The flat racing course at Horndean was made in 1818 and is still there although not used. Fifty years ago Horndean was a small village. Before Hazelton Estate was built there were fields and woods but the building of houses destroyed it all.
